content: The high point of your commute is looking at someone in your mirror who is so close you can see eyelashes, then watching them fumble for their cell phone. There was an automotive writer named Tom McCahill who wrote in Popular Mechanics back in the 50's. His idea was a 12 guage shotgun shell in every steering column set to go off when the driver rammed anything. All the "city safe" device will do is make drivers even less attentive than they already are.
